Definition 1 (id=torus.def)

A torus is a doughnut shaped surface. □□

In topology, torus is a surface with genus 11 and it is homeomorphic to the Cartesian product of two circles It is a compact 2-manifold.

It is also the quotient ℂ/Lℂ𝐿 of the complex plane by a grid L𝐿 with the identification such that given ω1,ω2∈ℂsubscript𝜔1subscript𝜔2ℂ, ∀z∈ℂfor-all𝑧ℂ, z⁢z~+m⁢ω1+n⁢ω2𝑧~𝑧𝑚subscript𝜔1𝑛subscript𝜔2, where m,n∈ℕ𝑚𝑛ℕ.

Identifying the opposite edges of the rectangle given by (0,ω1,ω2,ω1+ω2)0subscript𝜔1subscript𝜔2subscript𝜔1subscript𝜔2 gives us the doughnut-shape which is the torus as a topological space. Using the Weierstrass elliptic function ℘Weierstrass-p, and its derivative ℘′superscriptWeierstrass-p′, the points of quotient space ℂ/Lℂ𝐿 is mapped to the points of the elliptic curve, ℘′2=4⁢℘3-g2⁢℘-g3superscriptsuperscriptWeierstrass-p′24superscriptWeierstrass-p3subscript𝑔2Weierstrass-psubscript𝑔3 where g2subscript𝑔2 and g3subscript𝑔3 are modular forms.
